comments.body: Nah, this would make the game too easy

Here is how I would propose biome explorer maps could be added: Instead of tedious journey across thousands of blocks for that one mushroom plains biome, that biome explorer maps should be added to the game.

A biome explorer map is exactly the same as a regular explorer map only it will lead to those rarer biomes like a mushroom plains biome to save you the hassle as ordinary locator maps already do.

I feel that they should only be obtainable from master cartographer villagers. Even then the villager should only offer 1 biome locator map and it should cost a considerable amount of emeralds in the first place.
There are already plenty of reasons for the player to stay in the Nether.  Blaze grinding, collecting ghast tears, mining netherrack, and getting whither skulls.

The problem is that when things only work in certain areas (that are inconvenient in one way or another), people don't make bases there, they make AFK farms.  Sure, some people would make a base in the Nether to grow Nether Wart, but many more would just make an AFK farm and wait for the Nether Wart to grow while they're off doing something else.  And remember that Nether Wart used to only grow in the Nether.  I assume they changed that for a reason, and it would be a shame to revert it just to try to force people to play more in the Nether.

I try to AFK as little as possible and to do so I have as many of the things I want to be growing in the same place at the same time.  As such, any time I'm spending waiting for my Nether Wart to grow in the Nether is time that all of my other farms are sitting idle in unloaded chunks.

I absolutely support making the Nether a more interesting place to explore and build.  What I don't like is things that only work there in an attempt to force people to spend more time there than they actually want to.

@claygoddnesssari you reached some interesting points but @bilbo baggins I am going to have to disagree. People go to the nether to afk farm blaze rods and skulls. Exploring the nether gives you nothing more than quartz and the odd fortress
@bilblobaggins when I say "stay in the nether", I mean long-term like you would stay in the overworld

except the overworld is pretty! and the nether...is the nether. 

Believe it or not, and some people may disagree with me here, the only thing that would make me want to go to the nether more is if it were MUCH harder. The Nether is supposed to be this harsh unforgiving environment of flames and destruction.

I don't want it to be more "inviting". That would ruin the feel of the nether. "You don't WANT to go to the nether, you HAVE to go to the nether." (to craft eyes of ender)

I feel it should stay challenging.

@KyleDerpinton,

The blaze crushing is an AFK farm.  Also, you forgot to unpack the fortress aspect.  Fortresses are the main reason people go to the Nether.
@bilbobaggings there should be more attractions in the nether than AFK farms and fortresses. It should have biomes, mob and treasures which give the player a sense of adventure and dread.

Rejected. The End is already the sky dimension. They won't add popular mods into vanilla.

I don't see much of a point in the basic ice caves, if glacier ice caves exist. Plus, the latter would work really well, if icicles would have growth mechanics related to the warmth of the block they are placed under (water dripping and ice/snow related blocks being cold, lava dripping and magma blocks being hot). As in, a natural glacier ice cave would turn into a maze of ice spires all on its own.

Also, to make icicles more distinct from pointed dripstone, they should be more dangerous, but shatter upon dealing damage, requiring silk touch to mine directly and could otherwise be mined from just standard ice blocks with a non-silk touch pick.
Glaicer Ice Caves alrey exist (in rare chances) , but not Ice Caves, so technicaly its anwe idea.
Bamboos do overlap ranges with cherry blossoms, so this idea makes sense.
I love it, it would make it easier to find bamboo if you spawned mostly near cold biomes too, and be more realistic (bamboo grows in temperate areas too not just tropical)
For an overworld duplicate, just use mods. End update should be different.

And if u wear it u can look at endermen and they don't care

Also when you power a dragon head with a redstone signal, the dragonâ€™s jaw will open and close. If enderman heads get added, I hope a red stone signal will open and shut the endermans mouth (just like when it gets angered)

Also be able to put carpets on camels to customize like llamas
I think that they should name it the desert trader
I had the same idea!

I was going to post this myself, so here are the specifics I came up with: When Wandering Traders spawn at the Point of Interest for a desert village, they may spawn using one camel on a lead in the place of one of the two trader llamas with the exception of leaving the camel behind, maybe even unleashing it easily in exchange for an emerald, if there are < 2 camels detected in the village's volume. This allows for camel spawns that 1. maintain the implication that the villagers take care of them, 2. make camels still not too easy to get, but making them accessible outside of new structures, and 3. give a demonstration to new players of the unhittable-by-2-block-tall-mobs feature of camels, if the trader gets on it at night/when husks are nearby.
However, this change can come with the flip side that wandering traders will preform a check before they despawn from that village for > 4 (or 6? not sure) camels in that village. If there are more than the critical number of camels, they may try to "rent" one (give emerald, despawn camel) when they leave. Admittedly, this second part will be harder to implement. The trader could leash a desired camel (unnamed, unequipped) a few minutes before leaving, but it won't really be clear why at first. The transaction would have to be finalized only when they despawn so that people won't steal the emeralds and keep the camel, which means the trader'd have to drop an emerald on the ground, where they could be missable.

I feel like there needs to be a complimentary block to mud (e.g. a hybrid of mud and dirt) to help blend the biome to it's surroundings a little better. I also think having the leaves from trees branch over more above the player to make a 'roofy', enclosed feel would be very emersive, and potentially some mist and/ or fog.

An End ore, if added, shouldn't just be a Netherite reskin. It should have a more unique name and way to apply it to armour. Maybe it could be like the antithesis of Netherite, a regal-looking white tool/armour set that can float out of the void?
